thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Wednesday, 25 Apr 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: BRIEF-Whitbread Says FY Underlying Pretax Profit Rose 4.5 Pct

author: Reuters Editorial
title: BRIEF-Whitbread Says FY Underlying Pretax Profit Rose 4.5 Pct
text:
April 25 (Reuters) - Whitbread PLC:
* FY UNDERLYING PRETAX PROFIT ROSE 4.5 PERCENT TO 591 MILLION STG
* FY REVENUE ROSE 6.1 PERCENT TO 3.3 BILLION STG * FY COSTA UNDERLYING OPERATING PROFIT AT 159 MILLION STG VERSUS 158 MILLION STG YEAR AGO
* FY COSTA REVENUE AT 1,292 MILLION STG VERSUS 1,202 MILLION STG A YEAR AGO
* TOTAL PREMIER INN REVENUE (INCLUDING F&B) GREW 5.4% IN FY18 TO JUST OVER Â£2 BILLION
* FY PREMIER INN & RESTAURANTS UNDERLYING OPERATING PROFIT AT 498 MILLION STG VERSUS 468 MILLION STG YEAR AGO
* BOARD HAS FOR SOME TIME BEEN FULLY ALIGNED TO VIEW THAT SEPARATING PREMIER INN AND COSTA AT RIGHT TIME WOULD ENHANCE FOCUS
* BOARD HAS FOR SOME TIME BEEN FULLY ALIGNED TO VIEW THAT SEPARATING PREMIER INN AND COSTA WOULD ENABLE VALUE TO BE OPTIMISED FOR SHAREHOLDERS OVER LONGER-TERM Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:
